intro: Trachycarpus excelsus var. fortunei, commonly known as the Chinese windmill palm, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is a slow-growing, cold-hardy palm that can tolerate temperatures as low as -10°C. The plant features a slender trunk with a crown of pinnate leaves that resemble a windmill, giving it its common name. Its foliage is dark green and often has a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters. This variety is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded or partially sunny environments.
